pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]Wish I could say the same about the city.
No matter where I go, I feel so many eyes on me.
And I know they aren't just admiring my good looks.
\i[5]"At least you don't have to worry about that with our group."
\i[2]"When I look, it's definitely to admire your good looks."
\i[0]"I'm sorry you have to go through that. I hope we can change it."
\i[5]"At least you don't have to worry about that with our group."
cZeroCenterSmirk
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]True. You do give me a certain sense of security.
Of course, the private jet sure isn't hurting anything. I like watching the news, too.
It's only a matter of time until I see that headline. Either \c[23]Argus\c[0] loses, or steps up.
\i[2]"When I look, it's definitely to admire your good looks."
cZeroCenterSmirk
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]Right back at you, Delta. I'm really happy you chose to give me that apple.
Now we're partners in crime. Ready to take down \c[23]Argus\c[0], and look good doing it.
\i[0]"I'm sorry you have to go through that. I hope we can change it."
cZeroCenterSmirk
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]I feel like things have already \c[14]started\c[0] to change.
Every day that passes, the citizens favor us \c[10]zeros\c[0] even more.
If I were \c[23]Argus\c[0], I'd be quaking in my boots, scared to take action.
cZeroCenterThinking
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]I doubt they'll go down without a fight, though.
But right now, their inaction borders on negligence.
People are starving to death right at their front door.
MainCast
\pop[3]And where I come from, you never turn down a neighbor in need.
I feel like we could teach you city folk a \c[14]lot\c[0] about life.
It's a bit harder when every day is a struggle.
\pop[2]Every day is a struggle...?
\pop[2]I ask him something that's been on my mind this entire time...
\pop[2]The people who abandoned \c[23]Argus\c[0]. Did they ever seem to regret it?
cZeroCenterConfused
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]If they do, they never really show it.
I think they know what they're signing themselves up for.
They're usually super happy at first, but then it starts to fade.
cZeroCenterThinking
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]I don't think that means they regret it, or they're depressed.
It's more like a honeymoon period, where they appreciate the freedom.
The city may be beautiful, but those walls are definitely suffocating.
MainCast
\pop[3]Once they can truly breathe, it's almost like they have a new lease on life.
But just like all things, it quickly becomes normal, and turns into routine.
Day in, and day out, life on the colonies never changes.
cZeroCenterSad
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]It's a cycle that's definitely absent in the city.
As much as \c[23]Argus\c[0] controls you, it's still so chaotic.
I never really know what's waiting for me around each corner.
cZeroCenterConfused
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]It's definitely not \c[23]Argus\c[0] agents though, and that makes me happy.
At first, I figured it was only a matter of time before we got kicked out.
But seeing the public opinion slowly sway is actually pretty shocking.
MainCast
\pop[3]We always thought that your views aligned with \c[23]Argus\c[0].
Gotta say, I half expected that apple you gave me to be poisonous.
It was a big risk, letting you and your friends know that I'm a \c[10]zero\c[0].
cZeroCenterSmirk
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]But it's a risk that paid off.
Let's hope they continue to do that, yeah?
Our lives aren't exactly risk free. Yet.
\pop[2]I like how he threw the word "yet" in there.
\pop[2]He definitely believes in the same goal that we do.
\pop[2]Harmony between societies. A true, genuine, give-and-take.
cZeroCenterThinking
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]Anyway, sorry for the rant.
Now that I can talk, I guess I don't feel like stopping.

\pop[2]I ask him what made him speak to us, then.
cZeroCenterConfused
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]Desperation, I suppose.

\pop[2]Guilty? How so?
cZeroCenterThinking
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]Well, I don't want to brag, but I'm pretty resilient.
I reckon I could last a lot longer without food than some of the others.
So, in my mind, sometimes I wish you ran across somebody else.
\pop[2]He looks a little sad, but it's completely understandable.
cZeroCenterSad
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]And if one of my people \c[14]do\c[0] starve to death on the streets?
I know that in my heart, I'll just wish it was me instead.
So let's make sure that doesn't happen, alright?
\pop[2]Obviously I agree, since our goals are the same.
\pop[2]We all wanted the conflict in the streets to end without death.
\pop[2]It just remained to be seen who acted first. \c[23]Argus\c[0], or \c[10]Cipher\c[0].
\pop[2]It was like a standoff in the old west.
\pop[2]Both ready to shoot, but living in the moment where neither gun is smoking.
\pop[2]We're just the observers, wondering which one will be left standing.
cZeroCenterConfused
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]I gotta say though, I feel like my life is complete these days.
It's not like I never dreamed of living life in the city, you know?
My vision just told me that it would be an impossible dream.
\pop[2]Right. In his vision, he's older, and still living on the colony.
cZeroCenterSad
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]When I first had that vision, I was absolutely devastated.
It's like my future was taken away from me. At least, the one that I wanted.
Made me feel like giving up. Like any attempt at fighting it would be worthless.
MainCast
\pop[3]It took me such a long time to accept what I saw...
Spent so many years trying to prove it wrong, and see the city.
I remember the first time I got to see what was behind those walls.
cZeroCenterThinking
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]I'd go into the forest, and try to find the tallest tree.
When I got to the top, I'd peek over the walls.
It was always so bright, and lively.
cZeroCenterSmirk
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]I almost cried. It was actually kind of pathetic.
Just a simple reminder of what I'd never be able to have.
I'd look at the people, with a mixture of jealousy and hatred.
MainCast
\pop[3]They were kind of small, since I was so high up.
But I saw their faces, and they all seemed happy.
cZeroCenterThinking
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]I knew that a lot of struggles we faced on the colonies didn't exist for you.
And because you weren't aware of that fact, you'd always take it for granted.
It sucks so much to see people live your dream, and not even appreciate it.
\pop[2]I can imagine that would be difficult...
MainCast
\pop[3]One of my favorite things to do, was watch planes take off.
Just soaring the skies between cities. What an amazing sight.
I told myself that one day, I'd get to experience all of that for myself.
cZeroCenterSad
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]Despite my vision saying otherwise, I kept pushing forward.
So I hope you can understand what I mean when I said I feel complete.
Living in the city, being on a plane? It's just... all I ever really wanted.
MainCast
\pop[3]We always suffer for the choices of those that came before us.
I never really got to know my parents, but I think that's for the best.
I was stuck there \c[14]because\c[0] of them. They'd be an easy target for my hatred.
cZeroCenterConfused
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]And having an easy target for your hatred just stifles your own growth.
Maybe that's why \c[23]Argus\c[0] and city folk are still so old-fashioned.
Clinging to this belief that \c[23]The System\c[0] makes you superior.
\pop[2]I never felt like \c[23]The System\c[0], or city life, made me feel superior.
cZeroCenterSmirk
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]And that's why I'm certain I've chosen the right group.
This might sound weird, but there was something different about you.
Not just you, but the rest of the gang, too. I felt like I could \c[14]approach\c[0] you.
MainCast
\pop[3]It was the first time I ever got friendly vibes from someone in the city.

Even if I get caught, at least you helped me check a few things off my list.
cZeroCenterThinking
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]No matter how long or short this lasts? I still got to live in the city.
And not only that, but I got to be inside a plane, too.
It's all thanks to you, Delta. Can't deny it.
MainCast
\pop[3]I guess I'm just glad that I didn't have an easy target for my hatred.
It allowed me to grow, and meet people who I can love, and appreciate.
A real, \c[14]true\c[0] group of friends. I don't think I'll get forget you, or the rest of 'em.
\i[2]"You know, we could try being more than friends."
\i[5]"We're happy to have you. Let's hope for a happy ending, too."
\i[2]"You know, we could try being more than friends."
cZeroCenterSmirk

pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]Oh, really? Well you might have to get in line.

\i[5]"We're happy to have you. Let's hope for a happy ending, too."
cZeroCenterSmirk
pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]Yeah. The happiest one we can snag.
I feel like we can achieve it, if we really try.
Didn't you and your friends make a pact to beat fate?
\pop[2]We definitely did. They weren't a fan of their visions.
\pop[2]I suppose that unites us all with a common cause.
\pop[2]Living life the way we want. Seizing our own future...
MainCast
\pop[3]Living life the way we want. Yeah, that's perfect.
No mysterious corporations governing our daily way of life.
Just us, and our friends. Maybe one day, even lovers.

pic_camera : 53 : true : 80
pic_breath : 53 : 0 : 60
MainCast
\pop[3]Anyway, thanks for the chat, Delta.
Wanna head back to the group and keep this night going?

\pop[2]I nod, since this seems like a pretty good stopping point.
\pop[2]Now that I know him more, things seem completely different.
\pop[2]There's no longer a sliver of doubt that we're doing anything wrong.
\pop[2]Kyron was just like us, and he should be able to live the life he wants.
\pop[2]Whether that was in the city, or the colony, it should be his choice to make.
\pop[2]I still have some questions for Kyron, but nothing immediately pressing.
\pop[2]It was more like "how did he get in the city?"
\pop[2]Him or a friend must've had ties to \c[10]Cipher\c[0] and \c[10]Hermes\c[0].
\pop[2]But from what he's said, I doubt it's him. It must be someone else.
\pop[2]We sit back down at our table, and the group quickly assembles.
\pop[2]But the man who felt like an outsider, now feels like a true friend.
